intro: Eriocaulon decemflorum f. coreanum, commonly known as the Korean star sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its compact, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences bearing tiny, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
